abstract_summ: Unlike standard hospital face shields, the locally fabricated design was intended to be reusable.The individualized 3D protective face mask consists of two 3D-printed reusable polyamide composite components (a face mask and a filter membrane support) and two disposable components (a head fixation band and a filter membrane).This black swan event is challenging industries from all sectors of the economy including those industries directly needed to produce items that safeguard us from the disease itself, especially personal protection equipment (N95 masks, face shields) and much needed consumables associated with testing and vaccine delivery (swabs, vials and viral transfer medium).Conclusion: The 3D-printed protective face shield is well accepted in various interventions.Abstract In the case of pandemic crisis situations, a crucial lack of protective material such as protective face masks for healthcare professionals can occur.
title_summ: "Double Eights Mask Brace" Improves the Fit and Protection and Protection of a Basic Surgical Mask Amidst Covid-19 PandemicSafety Guidelines for Sterility of Face Shields During COVID 19 Pandemic3D-printed contact-free devices designed and dispatched against the COVID19 pandemic: the 3D COVID initiative3D-printed face protective shield in interventional radiology: evaluation of an immediate solution in the era of COVID-19 pandemicRapid prototyping and clinical testing of a reusable face shield for health care workers responding to the COVID-19 pandemicRegulatory and safety considerations in deploying a locally fabricated, reusable, face shield in a hospital responding to the COVID-19 pandemicHelmet Modification to PPE with 3D Printing During the COVID-19 Pandemic at Duke University Medical Center: A Novel TechniqueA new simple method of handmade face shield using A4‐size OHP sheet, during the COVID‐19 pandemic3-D Printed Protective Equipment during COVID-19 PandemicCustom-made 3D-printed face masks in case of pandemic crisis situations with a lack of commercially available FFP2/3 masksEfficacy of slit lamp breath shieldsA critical review of initial 3D printed products responding to COVID-19 health and supply chain challenges3D-printable headlight face shield adapter.The Rapid Deployment of a 3D Printed Latticed Nasopharyngeal Swab for COVID-19 Testing Made Using Digital Light SynthesisTheExperience for use of modified full-face snorkel mask as personal protective equipment during endoscopic procedures in the era of coronavirus disease pandemic.Ten Days to Implementation of 3D-Printed Masks for a Level-I Orthopaedic Trauma Practice During the COVID-19 Pandemic.
title_abstract_phrases: In this short technical note, we describe the sequential organisation of the design and production and highlight the advantages of additive manufacturing in dealing with specific aspects of sanitary crises.3D-printed face protective shield in interventional radiology: evaluation of an immediate solution in the era of COVID-19 pandemicAbstract Purpose: The purpose of this study was to report the clinical evaluation of a 3D-printed protective face shield designed to protect interventional radiologists from droplet transmission of the SARS-Cov-2.Unlike standard hospital face shields, the locally fabricated design was intended to be reusable.This black swan event is challenging industries from all sectors of the economy including those industries directly needed to produce items that safeguard us from the disease itself, especially personal protection equipment (N95 masks, face shields) and much needed consumables associated with testing and vaccine delivery (swabs, vials and viral transfer medium).The individualized 3D protective face mask consists of two 3D-printed reusable polyamide composite components (a face mask and a filter membrane support) and two disposable components (a head fixation band and a filter membrane).Conclusion: The 3D-printed protective face shield is well accepted in various interventions.
